attributes.action: Legalise hare coursing with a dog
attributes.background: Hare coursing was band in 2004 because of cruelty to animals if this is cruel then why can you hunt with a bird of prey and how can you slaughter animals for halal meat if hare coursing was legal it would save the government lots of money in policing if you have permission on a farm it should be ok!

attributes.action: Make more funding to have Admiral nurses in every county of the UK.
attributes.background: An  Admiral Nurse is to Dementia/Alzheimer sufferers what a MacMilland Nurse is to cancer.  I lost my lovely Mum to Dementia.now my father in law has it.  Here in Bedfordshire we do not have ONE Admiral Nurse. We need to look after dementia sufferers with care and compassion especially lone patients
attributes.additional_details: The nearest Admiral Nurse for the whole of Bedfordshire is Cambridge.  I found it abhorrent that this government were paying doctors £55 for every patient they diagnosed with the condition, that money should have been given to fund more nurses not as an incentive for someone 'doing their job. The figures, from the Health and Social Care Information Centre, show the number of patients with a record of dementia went up to 415,964 at the end of March this year.  We need to fund Admiral Nurses.

attributes.action: RAF Mildenhall as an alternative to adding a runway to Heathrow or Gatwick.
attributes.background: The United States Air Force pulls out of RAF Mildenhall in 2022. Mildenhall airport is fully operational and only requires the upgrading of rail and road links which would greatly benefit East Anglia and would be easier and cheaper than proceeding with Heathrow or Gatwick

attributes.action: Introduce a national strategy to reduce excess winter deaths
attributes.background: Every winter, thousands of people die in the UK due to the cold.  In 2014/2015 the number of excess winter deaths rose to 43,900 according to the Office of National Statistics.
attributes.additional_details:
Although there is a clear link between excess winter deaths and the cold, the UK suffers from higher levels of excess winter deaths than a number of traditionally colder countries including Scandinavian countries such as Sweden and Finland.

Currently, the government does not have a national plan to reduce the number of excess winter deaths. 

This petition is calling on the government to take action and introduce a national strategy to reduce excess winter deaths.

attributes.action: Provide funding for a specialist music teacher in every primary school.
attributes.background: The racism and xenophobia surrounding the EU Referendum has demonstrated the need for better music education in our schools in order to teach our children about other cultures, create safe spaces where children feel a sense of well-being, joy, togetherness and purpose.
attributes.additional_details: Primary schools often don't have a specialist; budgets are squeezed. Music stimulates cognitive development, enhancing everything from language to mathematics and empathy; it helps children to succeed at school and far into adulthood. The younger we learn the better. The experience of music allows children to build human understanding across differences of ​culture, creed, and race. Music-making builds a happy society: you make friends in choirs and orchestras; concerts are uplifting.

attributes.action: Ensure that the Brexit EU deal maintains free trade, research, and movement.
attributes.background: After the Leave vote, we must ensure that the rights and prosperity of UK citizens are protected. We believe that this means any deal should ensure our rights as UK citizens to live and work around the EU, maintain single market access to protect British jobs, and continue academic collaboration.
attributes.additional_details: Such a deal would likely be similar to that between the EU and Norway; whilst this may involve the UK continuing to pay some EU budget contributions, we accept the views of most economists that single market access is valuable enough to make this worthwhile. This deal will likely involve accepting free movement into Britain, too, and we welcome this; EU migrants are at the heart of British life, playing a vital role in many economic sectors but more importantly being our neighbours and friends.

attributes.action: Kendal A6 to A591 needs a Northern Link Road ASAP
attributes.background:
With the Current & Past Situation it's about time our Government invested in this Link Road.
2015 saw the Motorway Traffic come through the Town well over 10 Times.
And if future Motorway Closures M6 Between Junctions 39-36 & Bridges where to be Damaged we will have to put up with this Everytime.
attributes.additional_details: http://m.thewestmorlandgazette.co.uk/news/14291795.UPDATE__One_dead_and_another__seriously_injured__after_major_incident_on_M6__police_confirm/

attributes.action: House to urge Wrexham County Borough Council to not to demolish Groves School
attributes.background: The House of Commons should urge Wrexham County Borough Council  to overturn forthwith the hurried decision made by its Executive Board to demolish the remaining buildings on the Groves site in Wrexham.
attributes.additional_details: The House should note that this decision was made without consultation with the people of Wrexham or any other interested parties, and request that the Council sets out in detail its proposals for the site,gives due notice of a timetable for consideration of the future of the site and carries out, in accordance with its Constitution, a full consultation with all interested parties and then, having considered the views expressed in the consultation, makes a decision as to the future of the site.

attributes.action: Make the use of closed systems to administer anticancer drugs (chemo) compulsory
attributes.background: Healthcare staff administering chemotherapy are at risk of exposure to these toxic agents. The agents are carcinogenic, mutagenic & teratogenic. Long term exposure can lead to health implications. The use of closed systems when administering these agents can reduce the risk to healthcare  workers.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum in London to become an independent city state
attributes.background:
The EU referendum has shown a significant disparity between the future that Londoners see for themselves and that of the rest of the country. 
Citizens of an independent London may be more prosperous and happy as a city state and being members of the EU.

attributes.action: Enforce a wider use of the 'crossed grain' symbol on food packaging in the UK.
attributes.background: In many European countries the cross grain symbol is regularly used on a wide variety of food items and products. As a UK citizen I feel as though we, as a country, are falling behind other countries who seem to make gluten-free packaging a priority.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.coeliac.org.uk/food-industry-professionals/the-crossed-grain-symbol/, this link provides current information on the 'crossed grain' symbol.

For Coeliac Disease sufferers shopping can be a chore, as well as expensive. However if this sign was enforced on many more products and by a wider range on manufacturers, it could relieve some of that stress and even encourage the 'may contain' products to be made without.

attributes.action: Establish an English Parliament so we are equal to other nations within the U.K.
attributes.background: We petition the U.K. government to create an English Parliament to give English citizens political parity & cultural equality with the United Kingdom.  England is a proud & historic nation where her citizens need to have their national & cultural identity recognised & respected like others have.

attributes.action: Urge the Chinese government to stop the Yulin Dog Eating Festival in 2016
attributes.background: Thousands of dogs are tortured to death during the annual Yulin Dog Meat festival. They are skinned alive, beaten to death, burned with blowtorches and dismembered while still alive. Many dogs are stolen family pets - they still have their collars on. Yulin began in 2009, it is not 'tradition.'
attributes.additional_details: Officials have said Yulin does not exist, or that it is 'on the decline,' but the horrific pictures and press reports from 2014 and 2015 say otherwise (#stopyulin). Please sign this petition to ask the UK government to reach out to the Chinese government this year to intervene and stop this barbaric event in 2016. Sign this petition if you believe it is a matter of urgency that the UK government take this action in 2016.

attributes.action: NHS to encourage the treatment of type 2 diabetes with a low carbohydrate diet.
attributes.background: Professor Taylor has shown that Type 2 diabetes can be reversed using a low carbohydrate, low calorie diet.  The NHS has announced it is rolling out a programme to give pre-diabetics lifestyle help. There is no mention of the blood sugar diet which pre-diabetics and diabetics should be following.
attributes.additional_details:
The programme will cost £7 million pounds to run. The dietary advice will be the same as that currently being followed.  We have a diabetes epidemic so the old advice is not working.
Dr Maureen Baker, of the Royal College of GPs, welcomed the scheme but she warned "The long-term behaviour changes we need to see is hard to inspire".  However, there are forums for the Blood Sugar Diet which offer the support and inspiration needed which will also ease the burden on GP surgeries.

attributes.action: Stop the Work Capability Assesment for ESA, it is unfair and outdated.
attributes.background: When you claim ESA you are very quickly sent an appointment to attend a Work Cappability Assesment (WCA), this assesment invloves you lifing your arms above your head, touching your legs and a series of questions: What do you eat on your toast? was one of these questions.
attributes.additional_details: Since 2009 over 5000 people who have been forced to find a job have died after the WCA found them fit for work.

attributes.action: Make it law the EU in/out vote is in pen not pencil
attributes.background: Why should something like voting be in pencil ? I'm sure you couldn't sign anything in pencil

attributes.action: Scrap Energy Performance Certificates
attributes.background: EPCs (Energy Performance Certificates) were introduced as a mandatory requirement for all UK residential property sales from 2007 (originally as part of the failed Home Information Pack). This derived from an EU diktat, European Union Directive 2002/91/EC. Later, this applied to rental properties

attributes.action: Reciprocal removal of visa waiver for US citizens for the discriminatory HR158
attributes.background: In response to the enacted discriminatory bill HR158 by the US government, turning a large number of British citizens into second class citizens, we ask the UK government to uphold its ‘British Values’ of protecting the rights of its citizens irrespective of where their parents were born.
attributes.additional_details: The HR158 discriminates against British citizens who have travelled or are also citizens of Iran, Iraq, Syria and Sudan. Citizenship is commonly acquired automatically through ones father, and almost impossible to denounce. These citizens are some of the most ‘integrated’ and highly educated migrants in the UK.  They include prominent researchers, business leaders and many more people contributing every day to this country. All they ask for is the same rights as everyone else.

attributes.action: End the council tax for every body
attributes.background: We want the government to End the council tax for every body and we can have more money in our pockets council tax is unlawful

attributes.action: Ensure that the United Kingdom remains in the European Economic Area (EEA)
attributes.background: On 23 June the United Kingdom voted to leave the European Union. The outcome of the referendum must now be respected. However, over 48% of voters expressed a desire to remain in the EU.
attributes.additional_details: For well over a generation, we have taken for granted the economic, political and travel benefits of EU - and EEC - membership. While there is now a popular mandate for a negotiated withdrawal from the EU, it is also essential that the interests be respected of over 48% of voters who wish to retain the benefits of being in the EU. The best way to do this is through membership of the European Economic Area (EEA).

attributes.action: Stop the new INFRASTRUCTURE BILL.
attributes.background: This new bill will effectively privatize the Land Registry department. It means public land and asserts will now be In control of a private profit making company. This allow Fracking companies to set up in woodland, or parks, without public or council opposition.
attributes.additional_details: The government’s new Infrastructure Bill removes control for decisions to sell or develop publicly owned land from the public sector. In short, a private company will have the power to sell publicly owned land for Fracking, or whatever.The Infrastructure Bill has somehow managed to slip through to its Second Reading in the House of Lords from 1830 Wednesday 18th June 2014. The Bill contains a clause that will end local decision making over use of publicly owned land by councils or the public.

attributes.action: Legalise the production, use and sale of cannabis in the uk.
attributes.background: The use, production and sale of cannabis would create jobs boost the economy and has been proven to treat diseases and lower pain it would also allow the prison system to focus on real crimes.

attributes.action: All official campaign material for UK elections must be fact checked
attributes.background: We need to stop inaccurate or misleading information in official campaign materiel in elections and referendums (posters, leaflets posted to people, TV broadcasted, etc.). A neutral third party could be used to do this.
attributes.additional_details:
During the recent Brexit campaign, both slides used statistics that were widely regarded to be inaccurate - this needs to stop. 

In the past we could count on the media to do this, but it appears that we can no longer do this. 

We have official statistics and official and impartial organizations who publish statistics and perform fact checking these can be used.

attributes.action: Review the NHS111/Ambulance Service and ensure adequate governance/safeguarding.
attributes.background: In February 2015 our son, Harry Williams, died from Meningitis.  A catalogue of errors associated with the NHS 111 service including poor training and deliberate delays to ambulance response times, in order to achieve targets, caused significant distress and delayed treatment when he fell ill.
attributes.additional_details:
The Daily Telegraph revealed the findings of a draft “forensic review” of the matter, which said Mr Sutton pushed the policy through despite direct pleas to him from senior managers regarding the dangers.

The ambulance trust invented its own system to “stop the clock’” on thousands of calls, routinely downgrading the response to patients who came via 111. 
'This confirms our previous serious concerns about secretive decision-making and cover-up at SECamb.' Murphy - Patients Association.

attributes.action: EU nationals to apply for British Citizenship for free
attributes.background: Future Brexit negotiations, might restrict the rights of EU nationals to continue living and working in the UK. By allowing free citizenship applications UK Government can put this right, avoiding discrimination against those with low income. Applications should be accepted until 23 June 2022.
attributes.additional_details: By facilitating EU nationals to acquire British citizenship, UK Government has the opportunity to counteract the inability of EU nationals living and working in the UK to vote at the latest Referendum. Additionally, UK Government, by allowing free citizenship applications from EU nationals, will also send a strong message to those who wants to divide our society that UK is a truly tolerant country which values those who contribute to its prosperity.

attributes.action: Local Authority SEN Departments MUST be made accountable to statutory timescale.
attributes.background: This petition is to make Local Authority Special Educational Needs departments, accountable when failing to meet statutory guidelines, and those determined by Sendist. Local Authority's are currently not accountable when failing to meet those timescales, and this MUST change.
attributes.additional_details:
Having faced two SEN tribunals to date, I'm faced with another battle. 
The Local Authority SEN department procedures for issuing EHC plans, are governed by statutory guidelines, and also guidelines determined by Sendist Tribunal. 

However, Local Authority's are not held accountable for either timescales and as in my case exceed them by an excessive amount of time with no accountability. Local Authority's MUST be made legally accountable for unjust and unfair delays to securing SEN support.

attributes.action: we want the government and FCO to lift the ban on travelling to Tunisia
attributes.background: We are the only European country that has been banned from travelling to Tunisia. France suffered 3 terrorist attacks in 1year the last with the loss of 129 lives yet we are still allowed to travel there, We where allowed to travel to USA after 9/11, we wanted other nations to visit London after 7/7
attributes.additional_details:
Our government are playing into the hands of Isis, they attack Muslim countries so they can radicalise its inhabitants, Islamic state will use Tunisia as a breeding ground for future terrorists and leaving the ban in place is creating poverty and uncertainty.
 
Many Tunisian people are devastated that the British government have placed this ban on us.

We ask that you give us the chance to decide if we want to travel to Tunisia or not, we should have the freedom of choice as other countries do.

attributes.action: Iain Duncan Smith MP: Give sick cancer patients access to financial support
attributes.background: The benefit rules should be relaxed for cancer patients who prove they are genuinely sick, regardless of their age, employment status and financial status.
attributes.additional_details: Cancer comes with huge costs. Not just physically and emotionally, but also financially. It robs people of their ability to work, their livelihoods and their savings. While cancer is classed as a disability in some aspects of law, it isn't classed as a disability when applying for benefits. Under the current government, cancer patients are being denied access to crucial financial support. That support needs to be made more accessible - because cancer is devastating enough.

attributes.action: Make the wage rise, due to happen in april 16, apply to aged 21 and over
attributes.background: A person aged 21 and a person aged 25 still has to pay the same bills, the same rent and the same council tax. Although, in April 2016 NMW will rise only for over 25's to £7.20 per hour. I don't do any less work than a 25 year old but I am not entitled to a "living wage". Why?
attributes.additional_details: A person aged 25 can start work for the first time and receive £7.20 as NMW. Whereas I have worked my way up from about four pound an hour from age 16. I am now 22 and I see that I am still being discriminated against due to my age. What happened to equality, fairness and justice?

attributes.action: Cats not in an approved breeding programme should be microchipped and neutered.
attributes.background: Female cats can become pregnant at 4 months and give birth at 6 months.  This is not good for anyone involved. A legal requirement for neutering, plus compulsory microchipping to enable cat owners to be identified, would prevent this happening, and also take the pressure off cat rescue centres.
attributes.additional_details: At my local rescue centre alone, there are presently around 40 kittens, and things will most likely get worse as the summer progresses.  It happens every year, and the situation is repeated in rescue centres up and down the country, mainly due to owner ignorance and/or lack of responsibility.  Compulsory microchipping and neutering of cats would go some way towards preventing this, and would result in happier, healthier cats.

attributes.action: Stop the proposed closure of Paignton and Brixham hospitals, Devon.
attributes.background: Torbay is struggling to cope as it is and it will be the elderly patients that will suffer further.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory that all schools+colleges have atleast 1 full time counsellor
attributes.background: Mental health is an issue which just seems to be getting worse, the NHS is already under pressure and mental health isn't improving throughout the UK. All schools and colleges should have atleast one trained counsellor to help students and even staff, while taking the pressure of the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: I attend one college in Cornwall which has recently had all counsellors fired in order to meet appropriate budget cuts. The education system should care just as much about their pupils health as they do about their grades.

attributes.action: Hold a General Election within the next six months.
attributes.background: Britain leaving the European Union fundamentally changes the UK political landscape and the terms on which UK Government policy is made. Political parties should present new manifestos appropriate to this new reality, and the electorate should have the chance to choose a new government.

attributes.action: Allow Hamde Abu Rahma, Palestinian photo journalist a visa to travel the UK.
attributes.background: Hamde Abu Rahma is a Palestinian photo journalist from Bil'in in the West Bank.  He has been refused for a second time a visa to come to the UK for the Edinburgh festival despite having financial backing.  He's been shot at, seen family killed and still remains peaceful.  He wants to tell his story.

attributes.action: Call on Turkish government to end its military operations on the Kurdish people!
attributes.background: Turkey’s ruling Justice and Development Party (AKP) is undertaking deeply divisive military action in the predominantly Kurdish Eastern and Southeastern Anatolian provinces, which involves imposing curfews and blockades, attacking innocent Kurdish civilians with tanks & snipers, shooting civilians.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the curfews and military operations started hundreds of innocent civilians have lost their lives as a result. 56 curfews have been declared in at least 19 districts of 7 cities since July 2015. Resultantly, 600 civilians were killed. Curfews and military operations are still going on in the districts of Cizre, Sur and Silopi. 

So far, to the dismay and anger of pro-peace and pro-democracy forces in Turkey, Western governments have refused to condemn or highlight the breaches of human rights and brutality by the current government of Turkey.

attributes.action: Take into account the faith of Pakistani Christians when they claim asylum.
attributes.background: When considering Asylum applications from Pakistani Christians the Immigation Service should recognise that Pakistan is a dangerous place for Christians. To tell them simply to be Christian in secret is to misunderstand the Biblical command to gently and respectfully speak about Jesus Christ.
attributes.additional_details: This year's Easter Sunday bombing, targeted at Christians, is tragically just the latest in a long line of lynchings, church-bombings and house-burnings. In practice there is little or no protection of religious minorities by the authorities; perpetrators know they are more likely to be praised than prosecuted. See the list of atrocities on the Wikipedia page "Christianity in Pakistan". Search for Pakistan in the web pages of Barnabas Fund or Christian Solidarity Worldwide.

attributes.action: Build more social housing instead of the HS2 railway
attributes.background: The plan to upgrade the railway link from London to Birmingham is very costly, will take many years to build and will have a negative impact on the environment and many people's lives. Far better to spend the money allocated for this on social housing.
attributes.additional_details:
The estimated cost of HS2 is over £50 BILLION - it could be more than this of course: http://www.publications.parliament.uk/pa/ld201415/ldselect/ldeconaf/134/13406.htm
The benefits of reducing the travelling time by train between Birmingham and London are arguable, but look a lot less beneficial when the cost is so great.
20 years from now when HS2 is expected to be completed, it's possible that new IT infrastructure and working practices might reduce the need for business and social travel.

attributes.action: Amnesty for commonwealth illegal skilled immigrants.
attributes.background: In the time of labour government a huge numbers of students came from commonwealth countries but for the immigration cuts like psw tier 1, most of them left United Kingdom. A very few number of them are still surviving in uk in a miserable life, who can do work for the nation for batter future.
attributes.additional_details: The former honorable immigration minister and present prime minister knows everything clearly how they made the condition. So, please take an argent action.

attributes.action: Lower the cervical cancer smear test age to 18
attributes.background: Over the years on the news and media the country has taken witness to many unfortunate undiagnosed cases of cervical cancer. Many girls considered 'underage' losing their lives to cervical cancer because they are deemed a lesser risk... Previous events say otherwise
attributes.additional_details: So many young women and girls have unfortunately lost their lives to this silent killer all because cases of cervical cancer are considered less likely in women under 25 and are more likely to test and that only 65 out 3000 cases diagnosed are under 25 but they are still cases none the less. Surely the unfortunate deaths of previous young women considered 'underage' have not died in vain. Women's rights have come along way but why isn't this a given right for young women everywhere?

attributes.action: Gastrointestinal Motility disorders in patients with Ehlers Danlos Syndrome
attributes.background:
There is a huge gap in healthcare for conditions such as gastropareses, pseudo obstruction, dysmotility , intestinal failure etc
These conditions result in severe pain, bloating, vomiting, malnutrition and inability to eat to name a few.
This severly impacts lives, & quality of life is very low.
attributes.additional_details:
Although there is no cure there is lack of understanding by healthcare providers to the point we either have to tell them what to do ourselves or get sent home with little to no treatment plan, we get passed from doctor to doctor who each give up on us, many dont even get to the stage of diagnosis. 
I am asking for a nation wide campaign to educate GPS , Consultants, Nurses and health workers in general on the importance of management and understanding of these conditions. 
We should not be left to suffer with no one to listen, help or control the symptoms.

attributes.action: Call on the UK Government to urge the EU to increase tariffs on subsidised steel
attributes.background: The dumping of subsidised Chinese steel threatens the existence of the UK steel industry with, potentially, thousands becoming unemployed. This is not just a problem in the UK; cheap imports threaten steel making in the wider EU. We should call on the EU to impose higher tariffs on such imports.
attributes.additional_details: Due to State subsidies & overproduction, the Chinese steel industry has undercut EU steel by selling at prices which are lower than the production costs. This process has had the effect of depressing the whole market & jeopardising the future of steel making in the EU, including in the UK. Tata Steel, for example, has decided to sell all its UK plants citing cheap imports as a contributing factor. Any future steel production in the UK would face the same issue unless our government acts swiftly.

attributes.action: To ask Government for additional funding to postpone closure of UTC Lancashire
attributes.background: Parents and learners were told on the 03/05/2016 that UTC Lancashire would be closing on the 31/08/16. This will majorly impact on current learners from completing their GCSEs and A-levels in the summer of 2017. Please provide additional funding to postpone closure and to allow completion of exams.
attributes.additional_details: UTC Lancashire opened in Aug 2013-My son is flourishing in his subjects, he's hitting distinctions,despite never being a distinction pupil. He loves this learning environment and to have this taken away now half way through his GCSEs is so unfair.  The level of apprenticeship quality that is coming out of UTC is second to none. Learners are taught the skills, work ethic & given work experience to find employment.  The syllabus is so specialised no other secondary school can take on these pupils.

attributes.action: Formally consult resident EU citizens on whether the UK should leave the EU .
attributes.background: The vast majority of the 3 million EU citizens resident in Britain had no vote in the referendum on Britain’s membership of the EU and if they had been consulted the result could have been different.
attributes.additional_details: EU citizens are those British residents who are most severely affected by the result of the EU referendum but had no say in it. They have a right to vote and stand in local elections and elections to the European Parliament, rights that would be lost if the UK leaves the EU. They are now in a state of uncertainty and fear. This seems a travesty of natural justice. They need to be consulted, for instance by a referendum specific to them.

attributes.action: To make the A52, A15, A16, A17 in to dual carriage ways
attributes.background: The road systems in Lincolnshire have long been neglected resulting in unsafe potholes, faded road markings and an increase in road traffic collisions over the years. Due to the growth in population and industry the road in Lincolnshire simply cannot cope.
attributes.additional_details: By converting the four major roads throughout Lincolnshire into dual carrigeways this may potentially reduce traffic congestion within the main towns, decrease the risk of road incidents and encourage safer trade within the county. Within a year the A15 alone has seen an increase in road traffic fatalities due to an increase of vehicles on the roads - a dual carriageway on this particular road may make life easier for thriving agricultural and industrial businesses but it could also save lives.

attributes.action: Demand Regulation for Extreme Sports #ExtremeSafety
attributes.background:
Extreme sports are not fair ground attractions. Let’s get our MPs working with other EU member states to recognize this life-threatening activity requires serious regulation.

Sign and share this petition today. Tweet #ExtremeSafety to save lives.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-london-33618917

http://change4kleyo.org/

attributes.action: Stop the removal of NHS bursaries for student radiographers and nurses
attributes.background: An NHS bursary is currently available for students studying Radiography and Nursing. This is essential financial support as these courses involve both clinical and academic components. The Government is proposing to remove these bursaries and replace them with student loans.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS bursary supports the student to undertake clinical placements as part of their training. These can be up to 16 weeks in duration and in rural areas the distance between the campus and hospital is uncommutable, requiring the student to pay rent on their main accommodation plus rent, living and travel expenses in their clinical setting. This is financially disadvantageous to students in rural areas like Cumbria, Devon and Northumberland and will have a negative impact on the profession.

attributes.action: Assess both parents income when working out child maintenance
attributes.background: The new child maintenance service should take the receiving parents finances into consideration, to not put the paying parents family in poverty. The system at presents potentially can take from one child to give to another. Finances from both families should be assessed to make a fairer system.
attributes.additional_details:
The child maintenance does not take into consideration out going payments such as Rent and other financial obligations potentially putting a paying parents family at risk of being evicted. 
Maintenance should be based on individual cases. Currently the service does not take into account that the receiving parent could be with a high earner potentially putting another family in poverty. It also does not take into account an older child whom maintenance is being paid for is in part time work.

attributes.action: Bring back legal aid for family law. And give farthers 50/50 rights
attributes.background: it's diabolical that legal aid has been removed from family law. Dad's all over the country are not getting a fare hearing and through lack of knowledge and unfare rules that favor the mother we are loosing are kids. the law needs to be changed to stop mothers alienating fathers from there own blood
attributes.additional_details: My son saw a picture that was on my Facebook page and it stated dad's are just as important as mums.  I was shocked at my 7 year old sons response he looked at it laughed and said with no hesitation no theye are not and walked away. I was so upset at this because one day my boys will be dad's to. And they will start life having a very  low estimate of them self's as farthers.  And I think it's time for dad's to make a stand for our children...

attributes.action: British Parliment should not have a summer recess this year.
attributes.background: They should stay and work through the issues raised by BREXIT. This important to keep our economy stable throughout theses political changes .  Individuals should be able to take time off for family holidays, but for limited periods.

attributes.action: Ensure Knowsley students have the opportunity to take A-Levels
attributes.background: No school in the entire borough of Knowsley offers A-Levels, which are often required for top universities or courses such as Medicine, limiting opportunities for children in Knowsley. Most schools in the borough are academies, so change requires direct intervention by the Department of Education.
attributes.additional_details: The last school to offer A Levels in Knowsley, Halewood Academy, announced in April that they would not be offering A-Levels in the coming year. Knowsley is one of the most deprived boroughs in the country, and many families cannot afford to send children out of the borough to schools or sixth forms that offer A-Levels. This effectively bars children from going to top universities and studying certain subjects which require A-Levels, harming social mobility and hampering the dreams of many.
